decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, allowing you to bring back creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam. By cycling through your deck with cards like Cathartic Reunion and Life from the Loam, you can trigger powerful graveyard effects like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate, overwhelming your opponent with a constant stream of creatures and burn damage. This deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to generate strong combo plays and outvalue your opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and bounce effects. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Mystic Sanctuary. The win condition is typically flipping Thing in the Ice or utilizing planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also includes elements of resource denial with cards like Blood Moon and additional disruption with cards like Abrade. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is used to play powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and Karn Liberated to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Oblivion Stone and Dismember, as well as card selection and tutoring with cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By combining powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary, Bloodbraid Elf, and Wild Nacatl with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Wrenn and Six and Renegade Rallier to generate value and maintain board presence. By utilizing a mix of creature aggression and direct damage, the deck aims to secure victory through consistent pressure and efficient removal.

The main concept of this Modern Merfolk Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with Merfolk creatures, utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Collected Company to put multiple creatures into play at once. The deck also focuses on buffing up the Merfolk with cards like Merfolk Mistbinder and Lord of Atlantis, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Merfolk Trickster. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful tribal strategy, using Oko, Thief of Crowns for additional control and tempo advantage.

The deck focuses on using counterspells and removal spells to control the opponent's board while generating card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and The Royal Scions. Blood Moon is used to disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving the deck an advantage. The deck also includes threats like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to apply pressure and close out the game. Mystic Sanctuary is included to recycle powerful spells like Cryptic Command. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent with efficient spells and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on using a combination of creatures with defender to create a toolbox of options for different situations. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Arcades, the Strategist, the deck can search out specific creatures to either protect itself or disrupt the opponent's strategy. With access to a variety of creatures with defender, the deck can control the board and set up for a powerful combo finish. The key strategy is to use defenders to stall the game until the right creatures can be summoned to secure victory.

This deck focuses on protecting its creatures with hexproof and buffing them up with auras to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By giving creatures like Gladecover Scout and Slippery Bogle hexproof, they become difficult to deal with, especially with powerful auras like Daybreak Coronet and Ethereal Armor boosting their power. The deck also includes cards like Leyline of Sanctity to further protect itself from targeted removal, allowing it to maintain pressure and overwhelm the opponent with fast, evasive threats.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Narcomoeba, Gravecrawler, and Prized Amalgam using cards like Hedron Crab and Stitcher's Supplier. Once your graveyard is loaded, you can cast spells like Creeping Chill and activate abilities like Carrion Feeder to deal damage to your opponent. The deck also utilizes Vengevine to pressure opponents and potentially win the game quickly. The land base includes fetch lands and shock lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the key strategy is to use your graveyard as a resource to overwhelm your opponent.

The deck focuses on leveraging the powerful synergies between Spirit creatures with abilities that enhance each other and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom to boost the team, along with disruptive effects from cards like Spell Queller and Deputy of Detention, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining a strong board presence. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while Collected Company provides additional creature advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multicolor requirements for optimal performance.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to make Death's Shadow a powerful threat, while disrupting your opponent's hand and board with various removal spells and disruption cards. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns to further control the game and secure victory. The deck's game plan is to be aggressive and to control the pace of the game by leveraging your life total as a resource.

This deck focuses on using cards that mill the player's library, putting creatures into the graveyard. The goal is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Vengevine, Prized Amalgam, Gravecrawler, and Bloodghast. By utilizing cards like Stitcher's Supplier, Merfolk Secretkeeper, and Hedron Crab, the player can enable these creatures to return from the graveyard to the battlefield for powerful combo plays. Additionally, cards like Creeping Chill provide additional value by draining the opponent's life. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive graveyard strategy.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost, aggressive Human creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to boost the power of the creatures, and cards like Aether Vial and Reflector Mage to disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to win the game quickly through relentless aggression. By utilizing cards that provide additional utility, such as Charming Prince and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck is able to maintain a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's plays, ultimately leading to victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. By utilizing cards like Giver of Runes and Spell Queller, it aims to control the board while dealing damage quickly with creatures like Noble Hierarch and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck also has some powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Oko, Thief of Crowns to provide additional disruption and value. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing lethal poison damage to the opponent using small, evasive infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, supported by pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Scale Up. The deck also includes protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense to protect our creatures and ensure they can connect for damage. The inclusion of Once Upon a Time helps us find the key pieces of our combo quickly, while Spellskite can help divert removal spells away from our infect creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By combining mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple with efficient creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Drowner of Hope provide additional flexibility and control options, while cards like Path to Exile and Stubborn Denial help deal with threats and protect the Eldrazi attackers.
